fields.description: The rule template of the alert event. The possible values are: cloudPcProvisionScenario, cloudPcImageUploadScenario, cloudPcOnPremiseNetworkConnectionCheckScenario, cloudPcInGracePeriodScenario, cloudPcFrontlineInsufficientLicensesScenario, cloudPcInaccessibleScenario. Note that you must use the Prefer: include-unknown-enum-members request header to get the following values from this evolvable enum: cloudPcInGracePeriodScenario.
fields.name: AlertRuleTemplate

fields.description: The conditions that determine when to send alerts. For example, you can configure a condition to send an alert when provisioning fails for six or more Cloud PCs.
fields.name: Conditions

fields.description: The display name of the rule.
fields.name: DisplayName

fields.description: The status of the rule that indicates whether the rule is enabled or disabled. If true, the rule is enabled; otherwise, the rule is disabled.
fields.name: Enabled

fields.description: Indicates whether the rule is a system rule. If true, the rule is a system rule; otherwise, the rule is a custom-defined rule and can be edited. System rules are built in and only a few properties can be edited.
fields.name: IsSystemRule

fields.description: The notification channels of the rule selected by the user.
fields.name: NotificationChannels

fields.description: The severity of the rule. The possible values are: unknown, informational, warning, critical, unknownFutureValue.
fields.name: Severity

fields.description: The conditions that determine when to send alerts. For example, you can configure a condition to send an alert when provisioning fails for six or more Cloud PCs. This property is deprecated. Use conditions instead.
fields.name: Threshold
